topic.title: How to do ZeroNet hyperlink?
topic.body: Does ZeroNet have URL scheme or some other way to link to pages? I would like to have link from my normal webpage ( https://mailo.svetel.cz/ ) to my ZeroNet webpage ( 14WsrVBJcdTJNqghsb9sRrxxa2sJwiLjmP ) i can imagine something like zeronet://14WsrVBJcdTJNqghsb9sRrxxa2sJwiLjmP

topic.title: Anyone else playing with synths and groveboxes?
topic.body:
After more than month of research I finally bought my first music box ;) I would love if somebody has a few tips for getting started. If you just want to share your work, thats ok too ;)

Here is somewhat from my "before buying research" -- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbReVCIZw3JdIW548VYP7r3qfTbiRM7oQ

Here is stuff I think was useful learning material for me so far -- https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbReVCIZw3JeVAFNRgrw0Krbjud5f74ud

1614262972_1BsALUkhotDeqP9x5KLNLAn7Hepw3.body:
> [styromaniac](#comment_2977_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Try: http://zeronet.link/14WsrVBJcdTJNqghsb9sRrxxa2sJwiLjmP [...]

This seems to work somehow, but I was looking for samething a bit more native. Like URL scheme. 

Also the page checks statically `http://127.0.0.1:43110` if the other person runs ZeroNet on different port, it won't work.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2987_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): Well, of course. [...]

It is just URL schemes. It is already in browsers. ZeroNet app would just start to accept them.

Maybe it is just Apple thing, not sure. Here it seems that way -- https://css-tricks.com/create-url-scheme/ .

Here it is described in more generic way -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_URI_schemes#Unofficial_but_common_URI_schemes

> [styromaniac](#comment_2990_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I personally couldn't get them to successfully use the zero protocol, like opening links. I'm on Linux using the portable ZeroNet installation, so maybe that's why.

It's maybe not a thing yet. `zero://` was just an example of what I am looking for and then I was just explaining the example. I am not saying it is possible to do it that way.

You just need an app which accepts the scheme. It is pretty common when you click somehwere in your system on `http://something` system will pass it to a browser, if you click on `callto://something` it will pass it to a phone app.
